title: Okay practice
body: The receptionists are always very rude and not helpful at all, both in person and on the phone. The GPs are so great and really listen.

title: Excellent surgery
body: I’m 77 female luckily in reasonable health so my visits to the surgery are not often .I never had a problem getting an appointment, the doctors and medical staff have always been excellent and very professional. My husband is 79 and he too has never had any issues with medical staff infact we both say Burbage Surgery is a joy to visit after hearing stories from friends who live in other parts of the UK.We think the best is having our own dispensary and cannot speak highly enough of all the staff , they are very professional, patient and very kind , nothing is too much trouble please don’t change !!

title: appointments
body: I was told to make appt to have annual blood test. When I rang I was number 1 in the queue, 10 minutes later I was still number 1 in the queue. As many years back as I can remember the waiting time to get someone to answer is horrendous. The longest I've ever waited was 40 minutes. None of the other surgeries have this problem, so why can't Hathaway staff provide the same sort of service. It's a pity you can't answer the phone as promptly as you are at sending out text message reminders within minutes of making appt.

title: Good first experience
body:
Found receptionist and doctor very helpful
and efficient. Did not have to wait long for an appointment.

title: Jasmine Centre great people skills
body: The team at the jasmine centre were swift efficient and clinical while also being caring considerate and professional

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Receptionist
body: Very competent, was able to deal with enquiry and followed up efficiently and effectively. I felt compelled to call back and thank her personally. Very impressed!

title: Prompt Treatment For Elderly Mother
body:
My housebound  elderly mother who has cancer received the appropriate antibiotic treatment for a wound infection within 2 hours after contacting the very polite and reassuring receptionist.
The Duty Doctor rang me half an hour after speaking to the receptionist and I was able to collect the antibiotics soon after from the pharmacist.
I could not fault the care given.

title: Very satisfied
body: Reception, nurses and GPs have taken a great care of my son and myself. I always get response following the new Practice sistem by email following by gp phone call appointment.

title: Much improved
body:
I have had issues previously not being able to get through on the phone but things are much better now and I have found not much of a wait to speak to a receptionist.

I recently saw the new prescribing pharmacist who was absolutely lovely and a real credit to the surgery- hope she will be there long term. 

Also saw one of the GP's who was very thorough and helpful. 

I feel that things have really improved at the surgery.

title: Excellent service
body: The staff were extremely respectful and polite. I was seen very quickly and the doctors that spoke with me were informative, considerate and patient. I have never had such an excellent experience in a and e before. The a and e department was very busy but I felt as though my concerns were listened to and addressed with speed. I also really appreciated the male doctors repeatedly checking if I was okay with them doing the procedure and if I wanted a female to perform or have a guardian with me. Thank you!

readBy.name: Homerton University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank you
body: Thank you to the Dr & staff that I saw today. Seen within the hour & didn’t feel rushed when seen. Got a diagnosis & a prescription- what a great service to have nearby.

title: Visited A&E - The Staff Are Amazing!
body: I visited A&E this evening as was worried I might have testicular torsion, quite urgent and was in pain. The A&E itself didn’t feel great, it was a Friday night and we didn’t feel massively safe (purely due to a couple of people in there) but the staff are truly amazing! How they deal with some of the rude characters coming in, I have no idea. But I was seen in about 20mins, and the patience and responsiveness of the doctors and nurses is pretty special. Feel very fortunate to have the NHS there, they do some brilliant work.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Great help from the reception team.
body:
My mind was made at ease by a receptionist regarding a prescription l needed quickly.

This was my fault not realising I would run out of my medication over the coming weekend.

As l order online l was concerned it would not be filled in time.  Her information and advice helped me greatly.  

Thank you.
Christine  Crawley

title: Fantastic practice
body: Since I have lived here (5 years 6 months) I have never been treated as well. The whole practice are welcoming and helpful.The treatment of patients is great and the aftercare and follow ups are second to none. The doctors and other care staff keep in touch on regular basis and I can’t recommend this practice enough.

title: Hazardous environment
body: Waiting for hours on trolley, 3pm until 12.30 am, good staff but abhorrent environment once moved (still on A&E) filthy dirty, toilets with Diarrhoea everywhere, placed adjacent to person with vomiting & diarrhoea, asked to go back to original waiting area as it was so healthily Not safe. Once moved to a ward it was spotlessly clean, lots of staff but massive delays with everything. If teams communicated better then beds would free up much quicker, major delays with pharmacy

title: no communication
body: been here for 6 & a half hours up until this point of which we have been advised that we are still to wait another 4 hours!! No communication relayed. You have to hunt staff down just to get an idea as to how long you could be waiting for. Partner is awaiting blood test results for something that should have been dealt with a lot sooner based on her current condition. Overall poor service, especially considering the amount of national insurance that is contributed to the health service. Shocking place despite the issues with Covid, though that has played its part in months gone by. Surely not still an excuse.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent treatment
body: I’d like to thank all the staff at SpaMedica poole,my experience on both occasions everyone I came into contact with were very friendly and professional the operations went well and everything was explained so that it was understood so once again Thankyou for my treatment

title: Fantastic practice
body: I have received the most amazing, professional and kind treatment at Spamedica. I cannot thank them enough for what they have done and continue to do for me.

title: Perfect experience
body: On arrival I was made to feel very welcome. The doctor saw me dead on time for my appionment,  The doctor I saw was very thorough  with my examination  and explained my situation very clearly, he even took the time to listen to my second problem and organised an x Ray for me. I came away very happy with the overall experience.

title: very caring staff
body: I have been completely supported by the nurses in the diabetic clinic I feel they have done everything to help me.  Any problems I have had have been resolved.  Thank you so much.

title: Friendly and efficient
body: I arrived on time for a blood test, chèches in via an electronic system that included a health questionnaire and information on who I would be seeing. Very efficient and quick ( and painless) blood taking.

title: 5 Star Care
body: Recently underwent hand surgery. I was seen punctually at all appointments. All staff showed good humour and excellent care. I have used Private Sector on several occasions but the service provided by The Raedwald Unit was exemplarary and makes me question paying privately again.  Please convey my thanks to the Hand Surgery Team.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic care
body:
My dad recently had emergency surgery and was cared for firstly in ICU and then in ward 11, where he also had treatment with the plastic surgery team. I just want to say a huge thank you to each department and every Doctor and nurse who helped firstly to save his life and then to help him recover.  He received really good care and I was so impressed with the care and compassion of the teams there, you are all amazing and I am truly grateful to you all for looking after my dad the way you have.
If there is one criticism it is the quality of the hospital food he had to put up with, its a shame people who are trying to get better are fed low quality food.
But overall I'm just incredibly grateful that you do the jobs you do, a huge thank you!!!

title: Very efficient
body: Early pick up of serious problem help and efficiently dealt with Transfered to correct care and diagnosis depts quickly

title: Excellent care
body: Very prompt response to my phone call. I was seen on the same day and investigated. The doctor contacted me with the results and arranged a hospital referral. Very reassuring and efficient

title: Disorganised and chaotic
body:
Switched to this practice a few years ago, it was fine for about a month and then all downhill since then.
There are real problems with training consistency of the reception staff. They are doing their best in what seems like a nightmarish system.
Absolutely zero consistency between reception staff - seems like only one staff member out of the entire reception team knows how to use computers and digital forms, making it extremely challenging to process things like blood forms, medicine requests, even phone appointments. I have been there in person before trying to sort out a digital problem that the practice asked me to sign up for, and have witnessed another staff member essentially shouting from the back office to the front reception with instructions for my receptionist on how to fix it.
Was recommended to use a system called Systmonline for prescriptions then within about two months was told to use an app called Airmid instead (doesn't work, and I am very comfortable and familiar with how to use a smartphone). Then told to switch to Dr. Iq which does everything in its power possible to prevent you from booking an appointment for genuine reasons. 
Asked to change my personal details at the surgery due to change of name and contact details; given a wonky printout that looks like it was made in the 60s, didn't have half the details one would expect to be able to update in this day and age such as title. Receptionist was stressed and confused about this process.
My nhs records were updated but Dr Iq continued to have my old details. I addressed this multiple times with the staff but they have no idea how the app works. I uninstalled it because if I made any requests via the app, they continued to be listed under my old details therefore confusing the staff and inadvertently misgendering me when responding to them. The callback system linked with Dr Iq is awful.
Every phone call starts with nearly 2 minutes of my time wasted on a recording telling me to use this awful app.
On top of this, 9 times out of 10 when I phone up, I'm told to hold immediately which can be quite a shock - when I've visited in person I've witnessed the staff do this as well and it's obviously distressing the patient calling up from the other end of the conversation I notice. I have been inadvertently hung up on this way, and they never call you back - you have to sit through the same 2 minutes' recording then join the queue then they have no record of your conversation. Why not have a better call queue system?
It's pure chance whether you will have a text confirmation of an appointment or not.
This practice cannot be trusted to order a prescription for you what with the carnage of the staff trying to figure out how to use a digital system. I simply order via the dispensing pharmacy instead.
I have had good treatment from the doctors and nurses here *once I can get through the battlefield of trying to book an appointment*.

title: Haematuria clinic
body: I recently attended the haematuria clinic and was so impressed with how efficient and friendly the service was. The staff were friendly and respectful which made the whole experience so much less stressful than it might be. I even left with a letter detailing my results. Amazing service.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Excellent surgery
body:
The staff from reception to gp, always so kind and helpful 
I cannot fault this surgery and I am so pleased to have transferred, to this surgery. I have had minor health problems for a while, which had never been sorted. As soon as I transferred to St Wolston surgery,I was asked to see a Gp and was seen by a Gp  and my health issues treated . I cannot thank the surgery enough .

title: Excellent Support
body:
Attended the Sunderland Diagnostic Intervention Nephrology(sdin) b28 for a kidney biopsy. I was advised of the
procedure by the nursing team and the doctors. I was well looked after and monitored all the time. All I can do is thank them all for their support.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Impossible to see a doctor
body:
Doctors appointments are heavily policed by the reception team, who you speak to will dictate if you can secure a doctors appointment in the near future. If your situation is not deemed ‘urgent’ by the reception team the wait for a telephone appointment is 2 weeks. I’ve never seen a doctor in person at the surgery despite being a patient for 18 months.

There is a push to interact with the doctors via the app and E consult forms which pretty much eliminates any follow up interaction/conversation with the doctor.

title: Wonderful caring people
body:
The first time I have ever reviewed a hospital and Musgrove Park hospital fully deserves all the praise I can give. Wonderful caring and friendly staff, I received excellent care from absolute professionals.
So many thanks to all at Musgrove.

title: A professional outfit
body: I arrived early, expecting to wait for my allotted time but was assured I would be seen as soon as possible. After just a few minutes I was invited to enter the X-ray room where I was introduced to the two technicians that would complete my X-ray. X-ray done I was shown the way out. I duly thanked the team, and was in my car and home before my appointment time. A grand experience all round. Thanks to all involved.

title: Quick and efficient
body: Econsult works very well. I got a call back later that day for a lesser problem and in a couple of hours for a more urgent condition. Able to see a GP the next morning and diagnosis and treatment plan soon in place. Called a few days later to see how I was. Excellent service. Thank you.

title: I cannot understand
body:
I got a repeat prescription from my GP in Belle Vale 10 days ago, which never reached the pharmacy.
I call the practice and they literally lie, because it has never been sent (they checked in the pharmacy with my NHS number).
I finally had to call 111 to get it.
What is the point?

title: Pre-op and op
body: Had a pre-op on Thursday 18/8/22 and my op the next day. On both days I was made to feel comfortable from the minute I entered the building. The porter on duty was extremely polite and helpful. All the staff on the medical side were very helful and informative. Any concerns I had were allayed by the professional manner of all the staff at SpaMedica. Thank you for everything ❤️

title: Disappointed & Lacing Trust in Them
body:
I used to think that Dove Valley Practice were the best practice on the planet. But not any more. I lack trust in them now. After seeing a Paramedic person in May 2022 to be told she would refer me to physio, but she failed to do that. I had to chase it up in August 2022. I did get it referred immediately but that was due to my persistence. I had a telephone appointment with a Gp I needed to speak to them. I was told they would ring me sometime in the Afternoon.  I didn’t get to the phone in time. Had I have had a time slot like with a face to face appointment then I would have had the phone in my hand & been able to speak with him. I phoned back within minutes, I was told he would ring me back, but he never did. I visited the surgery as I needed a prescription from the Gp for my problem. I was told there was nothing they could do as I missed the call. Try iHeart Barnsley or visit the chemist. The chemist could give me a £18.00 solution for my problem, But I had to see the Gp to get the solution on prescription. I had no choice but to pay the £18.00 out as I needed the treatment. Something needs to change. I don’t mind having a telephone appointment, but I need a time slot please. Not sometime in the afternoon.  Also there are a lot Of new reception staff at this practice. They are nothing like the old staff. Why all of a sudden are the staff asking Why we need to see or speak to a Gp. That is my business. I feel that I am capable of ringing for a Gp appointment because I have something wrong with me, I am not ringing to waste the time of the Gp.   The appointment system needs to change with regards to the time slot. It cannot be an open time slot. If appointments can be sent from Barnsley Hospital with a time to ring them on then this practice can do The same. 
I have no faith in this practice any more. This practice has a lot of new medical staff too, some of whom are not actually Gp’s I fully understand that the medical practice is changing & there are new schemes being implemented, but the schemes need to actually work for it to be trusted & accepted as the normal way that the practice works

title: Fantastic Clinic
body: From the initial assessment to the removal of my cataract, I cannot thank the whole team the patient service was professional, friendly and totally committed to every patient nothing was too much trouble,Would highly recommend Spamedica.Thank you

title: Great hospital
body: Absolutely fantastic staff and hospital. Was in A and E a few times, in resus as well. Everyone who works there is fantastic.

title: Excellent
body:
Had need to visit today 20/08/22 . Waited around an hour . The doctor and nurse I saw , were thorough , sympathetic and seemed to genuinely care . Both had a very pleasant and professional manner. 
Thank you for your service . Excellent .

title: Great Practice
body: I have found all the staff reception, nurses and Doctors all pleasant, understanding, with a caring and and professional attitude. On the occasion I need an appointment I can always get one in a day or so. I have been with this surgery less that two years, I am so pleased I chose this one, Thank you.

title: Great Treatment
body: My experience for my Diabetic Screen Testing was excellent. The Ophthalmologist was very helpful in explaining in what she was going to do regarding the procedure.

title: Balancing out the moaners!
body: Having just moved to Maidstone from London and being very anxious about changing GPs, my two experiences so far (routine smear with a nurse and ongoing medication review with a GP) have been brilliant. Easy communication through Engage Consult, reasonable waiting time (for current times) and empathetic professional service. Thank you!

title: Let down by Headcorn Surgery
body:
I phoned up to ask for an on the day appointment, I was told I could have a phone call and to send some photos which I did straight away. I waited all day, didn't receive a phone call! I waited the following day incase they would phone, no phone call!!!!! I really find it hard to understand that Headcorn Doctors Surgery thinks this is acceptable.
I phoned up for a genuine reason, I don't ask for an on the day appointment that often. I normally book one in advance. I feel completely let down and have been quite upset as I feel I'm obviously not important enough.

title: Unacceptable Care
body: Was spoken to and treated disgustingly by a consultant who didnt have any empathy, sympathy or compassion towards the situation and felt utterly let down by the lack of care given.

title: very poor service
body:
I have an exemption card for wearing a face mask, yet the receptionist said that it made no difference whether I had one or not, i still had to wear one, I was only there to pick up a fit note and a prescription.

I do not appreciate being spoken to in a very rude manner, I felt that after getting what i needed, I had to leave as I was made to feel very uncomfortable on how I was spoken to

title: Poor organisation, no access to an appointment
body: Attended GP surgery on the Monday with results that did not get upload for 3 days onto the system, received a phone call from the GP on the Wednesday and results still not on the system. GP rang back after approximately 30 minutes and was told needed face to face consultation, informed that a GP could not book it and a care navigator would book it and inform me. After not hearing by the next day Thursday, I phoned and was informed that the receptionist could not book me the appointment and that I could only request on ask my gp, the receptionist kindly requested an appointment but if I was not contacted to phone 111 after 18.30. I am still waiting Saturday after nearly a week no examination, no diagnosis and no treatment. Extreme poor access to get care, I am shocked at the extremely low standards of  care delivery systems.

title: Wonderful staff in the Colorectal Department.
body:
Your Review:   My name is Mrs Chris Grasso and today 19/8/2022 I came to this department for a colonoscopy.
I cannot praise and thank the staff enough. You were all so kind and helpful and I was greeted with a smile from everyone. The skills of the doctors preforming the procedure was amazing and throughout the procedure they were so reassuring, I felt in such safe hands. The nursing staff were so lovely to me, the checking in nurse , the nurses who were with me during the procedure and those in recovery were the best and this hospital should be proud of their medical team. 
It is always worrying when you have to visit hospital but everyone put my mind at ease and for this I truly thank you. Please pass on my thanks to everyone in this department. 
The NHS at its very best.

title: unbelievably long wait
body: quiet a & e  only 2 patients waiting and no ambulances queuing but not seen in 1 1/2 hours and no apology.

title: Good Practice but communication difficult
body:
I have received good attention to date but getting through to the reception takes too long and communication problems are difficult to resolve as you have to find the time to wait around on the phone.

I have a particular problem in that I have been asked to supply information via a reply within a secure messaging service but there is a notification saying I am unable to reply in the service itself which is completely unfriendly. Not sure how best to resolve.

title: Professional friendly and efficient
body: Visited MIU with my son for an ankle injury. I was seen before my appointment time assessed, X-rayed and left the department within 30mins. The staff were friendly and professional and I would highly recommend this department to anyone. Thank you for all your help.

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: I had some breast surgery on the 19th of August. I spent the day on ward b1. I was looked after and cared for by some wonderful nurses. They did an excellent job of making the stay easy. It was my very first time in hospital (and I am a woman of a certain age) I also had to go across to the pink rose suite for a procedure and that was easy too. I arrived at 7.30 am. I had my operation at 4pm. It was a long day. By the time I had the operation I was very hungry and thirsty.  No sooner was I back on the ward, there was a tray of toast and jam, a cup of coffee and jug of water. Very much appreciated. The aftercare was excellent. They sent me home with a smile and lovely words. It made me  feel cared for. They all do an sterling job and often go unappreciated.  Well not by me. Once again thank you to all the staff and nurses. Date of stay 19th of August 2022.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Closed without notice
body: We took our daughter to the Minor Injuries Unit. After waiting for some time to try and enter, someone finally walked round and told us the Unit had had to "close for an hour or so". They wouldn't give us an approximate time of when it would re-open. This was without notice and there wasn't even a sign put out to let people know it was closed. We weren't given any information on where else we could go and no enquiry was made as to our daughter's condition.

title: Fantastic service
body: My family were camping at Robin Hoods Bay when my son stood on a blackthorn. We rang Whitby UTC and went straight there. We were seen within 5 minutes of been there. The nurse on duty was fantastic. He put my sons mind at rest when he was quite upset. My son was very frightened but was looked after so well. We were out within 30 minutes. Fantastic service. Thank you.

title: Excellent
body: I had to attend as an urgent case on Ward 2 Stroke Unit 19/8/22. I was greeted and welcomed by staff who were expecting me and had prepared a bed ready and waiting. I was assessed immediately with tests undertaken. I had to have a CT scan which they said would be a wait but was only an hour. Everyone was brilliant. Professional and kind. I was treated with respect and nothing was too much trouble. Everyone took the time to explain what was happening and the next steps in my care and treatment. All the staff were excellent; nurses; doctors; porters. Thank you so much to everyone. I much appreciate you all.

title: Exemplary Care
body:
My husband was admitted by ambulance on Sunday night,query heart attack.  The ambulance arrived very quickly and were lovely.
A & E we’re very efficient and nice with it, worked quickly, only in corridor for short while before being moved to cubical. I believe there were no beds in hospital,  we were lucky to be discharged next day.   Greatly appreciated to everyone who treated him.  We were lucky that they were not over run with patient.  The staff are doing their very best, it is the shortage of staff across the board that is the problem.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor service
body: Ever since the cameras left in the 2019 from GP behind closed doors this practice has been going downhill. The phone service is not fit for purpose and any feedback regarding complaints is ignored. If you come into the practice to make an appointment it is impossible and if you voice concerns about not being able to get an appointment to the receptionists you are asked to leave with no help. The practice is like a ghost town with no patients inside as they insist on doing everything over the phone and the patient car park is now used by the staff.

title: Sadly disappointed
body:
Dad came in with a bypassing catheter and haematuria. 
We thankfully put him in an incontinence pad to maintain his dignity as he was uncontrollably passing urine. 
The ambulance service were fantastic. 
He has mobility problems. 
He was discharged 13 hours later, after a failure by the transport department to locate his keys in the only bag he had on him, soiled in faeces because no-one had been able to help him to the loo and still covered in the blood he arrived at the hospital with the day before. Nobody had attempted to clean him up or even change the catheter bag, also soaked in blood. 
He had clean clothes in the same bag that had his house keys! 
On a positive note, he had nothing but thanks to the Doctor that saw him who also took the time to keep me updated about his plan for his future care. Thank you.

title: Terrible service
body: I turned up with my daughter. Had to stand to wait for a chair when there was a lot of empty chairs available. People were left standing with walking difficulties and the elderly. The staff showed no compassion and we were told 3/4 hours wait when you get a chair. The receptionist then went in to say in fact it could be 6/7 hrs and they will probably refer you anyway. Horrendous service and no comparison for anyone. They obviously all hate their jobs.

title: My Parents Surgery Needs Great Improvement.......…
body: My review is not about the staff or medical practitioners.  Phoning into this surgery is a major problem as you have to wait about 40 minutes each time.  It is very off putting. I am not a patient at this surgery and would not want to be because of the former.  I have to phone them on behalf of my very elderly parents who have medical issues.  The outgoing message is over a minute long before you can speak to anyone, my own surgery answers my call in 20 seconds. Big difference.  In waiting for my previous calls to be answered, I've started at no.26 in queue, when I have reached no.1 I have then had the phone put down and then on the hook.  Today I gave up after 20 minutes, and then tried again only to wait on a different line for another 25 minutes.  It has happened numerous times. The Reception clearly needs more staff but at any rate needs re-organising. The place also needs updating, there's a sense of things being "antiquated". The staff, GP's and nurses/nurse specialists are great though.

title: Not good
body: My dad was in there and the staff ignored me they have airpods in and they never listen we asked them if he can have his dinner and they ignored us so the care home is so bad and it should close down

title: First class urgent treatment centre
body: The service and care I received from all the staff at the urgent treatment centre was brilliant. I was seen within a few minutes of arrival and everyone I saw was a pleasure to speak to. The leg wound I incurred was dealt with efficiently and I very much appreciated the expert advice I was given. Thank you to all of you for looking after me so well.

title: X ray department not all staff deaf aware
body:
X ray receptionists very helpful and understanding. I have 2 hearing aids. They lowered their masks and spoke clearly. They said they would listen for my appointment call in case I missed it. Which they did. 
I went in for my X-ray  the man was asking questions and shouting but I said I have hearing problems and was worse with accents. I asked him twice if he could lower his mask but he ignored the request  
I eventually found he just needed my basic details. I felt very vulnerable and upset 
As I left I was feeling tearful and explained to one of the receptionists. She was very supportive and said it should not have happened   She said I could make a complaint to PALS but was too upset at the time. She said to inform them before my appointment and I can get assistance. But have not had this problem in ENT Audiology or Rhuematology. As I said earlier I would like to compliment the 2 very supportive excellent receptionist
Maybe your staff need deaf awareness training 
Mixed review

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Very efficient, amazing staff
body: I suffer from claustrophobia and dread going in for an MRI scan. I need not have worried the new scanner at the Global Clinic is extremely user friendly and comfortable. The staff at the clinic were amazing , thank you

title: Womens Health
body: Absolutely wonderful staff in this unit. Can’t speak highly enough. Had to go for a scan and hysteroscopy and the staff were really kind and made the whole experience go smoothly. I was kept informed of what was happening at all times. Thank you

title: Sensitive treatment
body: Our treatment here was perfect. I was accompanying someone to an appointment as they were unable to go on their own. After the appointment we both agreed that the doctor was perfect. Very sensitive to the patient's needs. Thoughtful and treated the patient with respect and empathy. We had been nervous of the appointment - the doctor put us at our ease the moment we entered the room. We are very grateful. The receptionist was also very helpful. All in all very impressed. Difficult circumstances were handled perfectly. Thank you.

title: First class treatment and care
body: I can not thank the Surgeons, and all other staff who treated me on Thursday enough, for their specialist treatment and care, thanks to you all, a credit to the NHS, without you the Country would be in a sorry state, fantastic from you all at Withington community Hospital.

title: Fantastic doctors & nurses
body:
I had to visit A&E as was struggling with extreme Nerve pain, I thought I would be just sent away like my  GPS usually do! But no they took there time to identify everything and even when they were short of beds they managed to make me comfortable and until one was available. 
The nurses and doctors had great jolly personalities and very understanding and great to talk to . They are very thorough. I highly recommend this hospital. I even recommended it 11 years ago when i had my daughter there and its only got better . Thank you to all the staff even when your under so much pressure you do a amazing job!

title: Outstanding care
body: I had to be seen by my GP urgently. I contacted the surgery mid morning. I explained everything to the very helpful receptionist/ care navigator who arranged for a triage call. The GP phoned me back and I was asked to attend the surgery. After being assessed I was asked to wait whilst a call was placed to the local hospital. Within the hour I was being seen at the specialised unit in hospital. The care and treatment that I received at the surgery was outstanding. The receptionist was helpful and acted immediately. The GP was outstanding professional supportive and kind. I was able to receive the help I needed swiftly. Thankyou so much to the team for supporting me in what was a difficult day for me. I value and appreciate having such outstanding care.

title: Excellent service
body: I attended A&E with a fractured ankle. From the triage nurse to the x-ray team and the practice nurse, they were all incredibly helpful and put me at ease.  Explained what was going on. They all introduced themselves and I felt reassured by their professionalism.  On a busy Saturday I was through and on my way home in an hour and a half.  I was even given a cup of tea whilst I waited. Outstanding work by all.  Please pass on my sincere thanks to them all

title: Brilliant service
body: Always helpful and call back system brilliant and being able to get same day appointment if needed is so unusual. I hear many tales of people having to wait days to be seen at many other practices

title: Great NHS Service
body: Never had a problem in getting an appointment, blood test, podiatry visit or medication review. Superb Practice I’d recommend to anyone. Lovely buildings and personable staff always willing to help. Friendly service. Thank you

title: Professionalism and Empathy
body:
My mum is currently a patient at the hospital and I would like to commend the first ward (the Stroke ward) for the professionalism and empathy of the staff. Their attentiveness brought the sparkle back into my Mum’s eye and she felt alive again. The nurses and carers joked with her and make her laugh, treated her with dignity and respect. 

Unfortunately, she has been moved to the Surgical ward on the 2nd floor where the nurses and carers are professional mind you but detached. Making my mum feel invisible and a burden, why such a massive difference in service delivery environment that’s meant to treat their patients humanely. When I asked her if she wanted me to share her concerns with the hospital authority, she seems scarce that their treatment may worsen. It’s unacceptable and inhumane!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Great practice
body: I came into childrens A & E for a second opinion as I had a bad experience at another hospital. My 4 year old daughter had fell in dirty and there was glass also around where she had fell . the cuts were deep and left Uncleaned the doctors were so good with my daughter and so thorough with looking at the wound, checking how her hand was moving. a plan of action was made. She went in as a day case the following morning ward 76 for them to put her under anaesthetic so they could check there was no damage they hadn’t been able to see , give it a good clean out and a stitch. All the staff on this ward were also fantastic with my daughter. Thankyou to everyone who helped with her care you were all so professional and helpful.

title: Deflated
body:
After waiting months & having 2 appointments cancelled,  I finally got to see someone. And felt like I shouldn't have bothered. I have psoriasis on my hands & feet mainly, the rest has mostly cleared up in the waiting period. Whilst it may not be as bad as some who visit the department, it is extremely painful to me. But I was told it's 'not bad'. Its improved to how it was, as I have been treating it for many months myself,  and visited the podiatrist twice, but having to walk on it is sometimes agony. 
I didn't expect to get an instant result,  but I was made to feel like I was wasting her time and mine, and basically making a fuss over nothing. 
I was given a printout of information that I have already accessed online, which was illegible in places.
Whilst I understand the nhs is under pressure and appointments are rare, everyone's symptoms are unique to them and everyone should be given the same care and understanding that they deserve. I should not have been dismissed as my feet are not bad. Tell me that when you have spent a day walking on them. 
I have visited the dermatology department countless times with my son over the years, and never have I experienced such a dismissive attitude. 
Very disappointed with the service.
Maybe staff need reminding that all patients matter, and their experience is what is important when they have an appointment.

title: No appointments
body: Called on 15 August, first appointment available for face to face with GP 12 September or phone consultation 5 September. Had to call 111 who got GP to call me, then asked to attend for blood and urine tests. Called again on 17 August for test result and asked the receptionist if I could speak with a GP or could a GP call me as I had deteriorated the receptionist said no I could not speak with a GP and no GP would be able to call me back. Had to call 111 again this time 111 GP told me to attend Urgent Care without delay. Fast tracked at Urgent Care put on a cocktail of IV antibiotics admitted into hospital 5 days later still in hospital. Since the pandemic this surgery appears to have forgotten about its patients.

title: Refused help
body:
After speaking to 111 i was advised to attend accident and emergency 
Upon arrival at A&E i was told that they would not see me and I should just contact my GP monday morning 
After being in intense pain all weekend and waiting for the advice of 111 to be refused even entry as the ‘Senior Sister’ sat at the front decided it was urgent enough was beyond upsetting

readBy.name: Milton Keynes University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful
body: Twice I have been due a follow up on the medication I take , they let me run out of medication until I have to call them up myself to tell them I've ran out. That means I have to suffer in pain for days and days until they finally tell me , I need a blood test , and when I go for a blood test my GP have no clue what blood samples they're taking from me or where to send it , this is an absolute shambles,  and it's happening all the time.

title: A Jewel in Oldham's Crown
body: Had my cataract operation here just yesterday. This is an amazing place. All the staff, medical and admin., are wonderful and the environment is beautifully clean. Everybody made me feel at ease and each step was clearly explained. I have no qualms about having my other eye done in 6 weeks time. Would recommend it without reservation. You are amazing!

title: Radiology
body: Absolutely fantastic. Weekend chest X-ray- quick , clean and the Radiologist was so nice - put me at ease . This is my second visit always a great experience.

title: disgusting dirty ward Evan's for women
body: my daughter got bad infection as she was in Evan's ward over month and in other one 2 months dirty toilet and mostly dirty showers no one clean there unbelievable my daughter suffer bec of them in both legs infection  I have to pay cabs to hospital emergency now !! it hospital for mentaly sick women it shut be clean everywhere specially toilets and showers

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: The best practice
body:
I have had nothing but 100% care from this practice. There is not another one like it. The response times have always been spot on no waiting for weeks like other surgeries. Congrats to all who work for this surgery.
John Rosevear

title: Wonderful staff
body:
From the moment I walked into the Endoscopy department I felt at ease and well cared for by all the staff.
The whole appointment ran smoothly and efficiently.
My sincere thanks to the team for your care and kindness.

title: Smoking and security
body: For being called the queens hospital it an absolute disgrace of a hospital. Out side of the main entrance plastered all on the walls are signs everywhere stating it is a smoke free hospital and even telling people not to smoke there but still they smoke there. As well as there being a ridiculous amount of smokers all out the front of the hospital with kids and elderly walking in and out of the front entrance getting a lot of second hand smoke. Most of the smokers sat out side are on the only available hospital wheelchairs spitting all on the floors and chairs leaving no end amount of rubbish and never cleaning it up or even cleaning the chair at all whilst covid 19 is still in effect. A lot of the smokers out side the main entrances can be seen fighting with each other and being aggressive to all staff and security or general public. Taxi drivers parking and obstructing all cars parked in staff car parks and obstructing access for any ambulances trying to get into ambulance bays if any available not take up by either taxi’s or other car not being moved by security which is never around or can never be found if you do manage to find them they just say there’s nothing they can do about it at all. Half the time the can be found the other side of the hospital sat on the phones doing no work at all. If her majesty’s had to ever visit the hospital I believe she would absolutely mortified and disgusted with her visit!

title: Very poor service
body: I booked privately and have had nothing but problems, appointment after appointment was cancelled including due to a nurse calling in sick, surely a private hospital has more than one nurse! Finally had an appointment they kept, and had a biopsy of which 10 weeks and numerous phone calls later I am still waiting for the results.  This is a disgusting service and really wish I’d have saved my money and gone elsewhere. The hospital facilities themselves are quite old and basic and in much need of updating but it is the poor service and communication I have an issue with.  Needless to say I will not be going back here.

title: Great Practice and Amazing Staff
body: I have been with this medical practice since birth and never once had a bad experience, from the receptionists, to the telephone call with a clinician to nurse to get tests done. Then prompt text message with my results over the weekend, explaining what is the problem and the plan of action is. Ready for myself to make further arrangements around my work and there’s for a follow up.

title: Good practice but like all of the nhs, under…
body: I find most of the staff, nurses and doctors try their best for their patients. Some are more patient and efficient than others, some are kinder than others - because they are human. I have always found the treatment I received to be good and caring.

title: Brilliant Patient-centered Medical Practice
body:
I was able to get an appointment with a GP by explaining to the Receptionist what my medical condition was. The Doctor was extremely compassionate, friendly and caring during our conversation, respectful of my wishes in discussing suitable treatments and made me comfortable and appreciate the service being provided to me.

I am looking forward to receiving effective and efficient service from the new practice owners in the future

title: COVID vaccinations by rude dismissive staff
body:
On arrival I explained to the vaccinator that I had concerns over the vaccine and have a long list of allergies.  I asked if there was an EpiPen present as I have anaphylaxis for other medications.  The vaccinator rolled her eyes at me and rather than getting an EpiPen went to get who I assume to be the senior nurse.  No introductions were given and I was again asked why I wanted to know if an EpiPen was present.  I explained that I had medicinal anaphylaxis but do not have an EpiPen as there are avoidable (in my GPs opinion).  I was then flippantly told they can't be serious then.
Given my last vaccine cause localised swelling I asked to go in the other arm to which both present again rolled their eyes and made dismissive sounds followed by the senior nurse saying 'well it's your body'.

Unfortunately neither of the staff understood that I come from a clinical healthcare background and my wife who was also present is a paramedic.  The attitude shown was at best dismissive, at worst a form of bullying and should not be tolerated by anyone.  Just because they are either poorly trained or lack enthusiasm does not dictate that this is the way they should behave.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic practice with excellent staff
body: Came in to Hollybank for a minor (local anesthetic) hip procedure and was treated exceptionally well by the pre op, surgical and post op staff.  They are so friendly and reassuring.  Couldn't rate the practice and staff any higher!

title: Poor communication
body:
Consultation 1 hour late! No apology.
Outpatients information board completely void of information. TV covered paper notices, thus made unreadable. Had I arrived 1 hour late my guess is I would not have been treated. I have not included website addresses.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Excellent care
body:
Myself and my family have been attending Grange Street for 22 years. The doctors, clinical staff and receptionists are all helpful, kind and efficient. 

We have had several significant health events and every time we have been taken seriously in reporting symptoms have been dealt with with great care and have had positive outcomes, once thanks to the swift actions of the medical staff in diagnosing an urgent condition. Highly recommended and a really good surgery.

title: Disgusted
body: I spent 4 days in A&E waiting for bed. After being here over a week I've been on 3 different ward and 4 different bays and rooms.  The nursing staff in the majority are brilliant but some just downright rude, ignorant and show no interest. Personal Hygiene is non existent.  You have to ask for a wash, shower, clean teeth etc. Being disabled it's difficult.  Nurses are extremely short handed but to leave sick people with no sufficient care is unforgivable.

title: Great service
body: Managed to book an appointment for on the day and had a comfortable talk with the doctor about my concerns, and was provided with a solution which would suit me best.

title: Long stay
body: I had an emergency operation for bowel cancer in April of this year and although the surgery was initially  successful, I developed serious complications later,  which required me to stay on Willowby  ward for seven weeks . During that time all members of the staff with one possible exception treated me with the utmost care and attention. The nurses were unfailingly cheerful , calm, professional and patient , even when dealing with some difficult patients. From the ward manager , nutritionist, porters, cleaners , the wonderful surgeon and doctors , chaplains and re enablement staff, all are a credit to the service and I would recommend this hospital to anyone.

title: Fantastic Staff!
body:
I have now had all of my children at hinchingbrook and I have recommended friends to come here also! The midwives and HCAs are absolutely amazing and so caring and helpful. 
I had complications during my last labour and the following few days after. The Midwives, consultants and HCAs were very supportive and caring!! I cannot thank them enough for what they have done for me during this time.
From the start of my pregnancy to the end they have been amazing and I will always recommend hinchingbrook!!

title: AskMyGP timings.
body:
I am currently feeling unwell, but not ill enough for an ambulance.
I have previously used the AskMyGP to get medical advice or an appointment.
I work shifts, and am not able to access the 6-10am time slot. Why is it so restricted. e.g. not open in the afternoon.
I will probably have to attend the busy A&E department.

title: A and E
body: Having visited A & E on two occasions this week due to my husband being poorly. Every member of staff is caring and can’t do enough for you. I know sometimes its quite a wait but once you get to see the team dealing with you they are excellent and thorough. Diagnosis is explained in great detail and explained clearly to you and you feel reassured that you will get the best treatment.

title: Rude receptionist
body: When I phoned the surgery regarding a prescription the receptionist spoke to me like I was a child.  I would appreciate that they speak to patients like they would like to be spoken to and not patronising please.  That is the first time I have been spoken to in that way and I did not like it.  Normally they are advising you about your illness,  but this time she told me she didn't have any information about me and I am not psychic so I would appreciate it if your receptionist next time could be a bit more polite and treat me like an adult and not a child.  Thank you Teresa Quinn

title: Thank you for the care of my little girl
body: Just wanted to say a huge thank you to the staff at the children's A&E for treating my little girl who had 'nursemaids elbow'. Our first trip to Hull Royal since taking her out of there as a new born baby. We were seen quickly and he care, nurture and kindness from the staff was incredible, as was the receptionist who was dealing with two abusive parents. In and out in 2 hours and not sitting without an update for more than 15 minutes on a busy weekend. Children's ward was so child friendly and my little girl was really relaxed. Shout out to the X ray team who made a scary situation a positiclve experience.Perfect example of when the NHS works well. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
NHS Bradford District and Craven CCG

title: Not Good!
body:
Went to Imaging A walk in clinic on Sunday for chest X-ray. Was told clinic doesn’t run at weekends, even though my gp told me it does & it says on the website it does. So either it does or doesn’t run at weekends. Which is it? 
Receptionist asked radiologist if they would see me as there were only 2 other patients waiting. Radiologist said No!
Bad service!!
